description: Game setup complete with 8 players
Blood on the Clocktower game started with 8 players
Setup phase complete, transitioning to Night phase
Storyteller → Olivia, Daniel, Emma, James, William, Emily, Susan, John: Night has begun on round 1.

Storyteller → Susan: Three good roles not in play are Librarian, Chef, Saint. The Evil team can use those roles to bluff since there will be no other players with those roles. Your minion(s) are Olivia
Storyteller → Olivia: The Demon is Susan. You are the only minion.

Storyteller → Olivia: THE GRIMOIRE:
=== PLAYER CHARACTERS ===
Olivia: Spy (ALIVE)
Daniel: Slayer (ALIVE)
Emma: Empath (ALIVE)
James: Mayor (ALIVE)
William: Fortuneteller (ALIVE)
Emily: Recluse (ALIVE)
Susan: Imp (ALIVE)
John: Virgin (ALIVE)

=== DRUNK & POISONED ===

=== ACTIVE REMINDER TOKENS ===
These tokens are used to track information about players such as who the Fortuneteller's Red Herring is.
Fortuneteller - Fortuneteller_Red_Herring: Emma

grimoire_info:

description: Storyteller → Emma: 0 of your 2 alive neighbors are evil.

Storyteller → William: Yes, one of Daniel and Emma is the Demon. Your reasoning: As a Fortune Teller, I want to strategically choose players that might give me useful information. Daniel and Emma are in different parts of the seating arrangement, which helps me gather more diverse information about potential Demon placement.

metadata.private_reasoning: As a Fortune Teller, I want to strategically choose players that might give me useful information. Daniel and Emma are in different parts of the seating arrangement, which helps me gather more diverse information about potential Demon placement.

description: Olivia updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• HISTORY SUMMARY:
  - Round 1 Night: Learned Susan is the Demon
  - I am the only Minion in the game
  - Grimoire reveals full character list
  - William (Fortune Teller) has Emma as a Red Herring

• STRATEGIC ADVICE:
  - Maintain a convincing Good player persona to avoid suspicion
  - Collaborate with Susan (Demon) subtly to avoid drawing attention
  - Watch William (Fortune Teller) closely as he might detect Evil players
  - Use Spy ability to gather information about potential threats
  - Help create confusion and misdirect the Good team's investigation efforts

description: Daniel updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• History Summary:
  - Game started, currently in Round 1 Night phase
  - 8 total players: Olivia, Daniel, Emma, James, William, Emily, Susan, John
  - All players currently alive

• Strategic Action Points:
  - Use Slayer ability carefully, only attempt on a suspected Demon to maximize chances of success
  - Observe player interactions and voting patterns to identify potential Evil players
  - Coordinate with other Good players to share information and narrow down Demon's identity
  - Be cautious about revealing Slayer status too early to prevent being targeted by Evil team
  - Actively participate in day discussions to help the Good team gather information and make informed decisions

description: Emma updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game History:
  - Round 1 Night: Storyteller informed me that 0 of my 2 alive neighbors are evil

  - All players currently alive

• Strategic Advice:

  - Look for patterns in nominations and voting that might reveal evil team members

description: James updated their notes

metadata.notes:

  - First round, currently in Night phase

• Strategic Recommendations:

description: William updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• History Summary:
  - Round 1 Night: Received Fortune Teller information that either Daniel or Emma is the Demon
  - Storyteller's choice was strategic, picking players from different parts of the seating arrangement

• Strategy Advice:
  - Carefully observe Daniel and Emma's behavior during the day to gather more information about who might be the Demon
  - Do not immediately reveal my Fortune Teller information to avoid being targeted by the Evil team
  - Look for inconsistencies in Daniel and Emma's statements or interactions with other players
  - Consider sharing my information selectively with players who seem trustworthy
  - Be prepared to use my ability again in future nights to confirm or deny initial suspicions

description: Emily updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game Start: Round 1, Night Phase
• Full Player Count: 8 players (Olivia, Daniel, Emma, James, William, Emily, Susan, John)
• All players currently alive
• As Recluse, I can potentially register as Evil or as a Minion/Demon, even when a ghost

Strategic Considerations:
• Do not reveal Recluse ability immediately, as it could make me look suspicious
• Look for opportunities to sow confusion about my alignment without actively lying
• Pay close attention to potential Evil players' behaviors and inconsistencies
• Try to build trust with Good team members through collaborative communication
• Be prepared to use my unique ability to potentially protect the Good team by creating doubt about my true alignment

description: Susan updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• History Summary:
  - Round 1, Night Phase began
  - Storyteller informed me that three good roles not in play are Librarian, Chef, Saint
  - Olivia is confirmed as my minion
  - Game setup is 8 players total

• Strategic Action Points:
  - Use the bluff roles (Librarian, Chef, Saint) strategically to create confusion and misdirection
  - Work closely with Olivia to coordinate evil team strategy and information sharing
  - Plan my nightly kill carefully to disrupt good team's potential information gathering
  - Maintain a credible and non-suspicious demeanor during day discussions
  - Identify and potentially eliminate players who might be information-gathering roles (Fortune Teller, Empath)

description: John updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game Start: Round 1, Night Phase
• Full game setup: 5 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon
• 8 total players, all currently alive
• My role is Virgin (Townsfolk/Good team)
• Unique ability: If nominated by a Townsfolk, nominator is immediately executed

Strategic Advice:
• Be cautious about being nominated to prevent revealing information
• Watch for potential Townsfolk nominators who might accidentally trigger my ability
• Gather information during discussions to help identify the Demon
• Consider carefully when/if to reveal my Virgin status
• Look for patterns of behavior that might indicate Evil team members
